head.supplied: Office of Lands and Survey, ¶ Melbourne, 8th February, 1866. ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ In returning the accompanying rules for the protection and management of the Royal Park reserve, ¶ duly signed by the Board of...

div.p: D66/36, unit 18, VPRS 242 crown reserves correspondence files, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.

The correspondent is assumed to be Arthur Morrah, the senior clerk in the Administrative Branch headed by Clement Hodgkinson as Assistant Commissioner, who signed several other letters to M. Approval of the regulations was requested in M to J. Grant, 24 January 1866 (in this addition as 66-01-24b).
Office of Lands and Survey,

In returning the accompanying rules for the protection and management of the Royal Park reserve,
Regulations for the protection and management of the Royal Park.
The Royal Park having been reserved as a recreation ground for the public, and for Zoological purposes, the Board of Land and Works in pursuance of the 67th clause of the
Amending Land Act 1865
, have made the following Rules and Regulations for the care protection and management of the same:—
1. The gates of the Park shall be open from sunrise to sunset.
2. Persons riding in hired carriages which ply for hire, or in carts or vehicles conveying merchandise, or used for purposes of trade shall not travel through or along any of the roads in the Royal Park: Provided that persons employed by the Acclimatisation Society or in connection with the Powder Magazine or the Experimental Farm, may drive carts or drays through the Park under such conditions as the Board of Land and Works may impose.
3. Persons shall not ride or drive on the grass, or on the footways, and each shall keep his own side of the road as on Public Roads.
4. Persons shall not enter the Park for the purpose of breaking in horses, or training or exercising horses, nor shall any person be permitted to drive cattle or sheep through the Park.
5. Persons shall not climb any of the fences, nor damage the fences or trees, nor molest any of the animals in the Park.
6. Persons shall not be permitted to bring dogs into the Park, nor shall any person discharge firearms, or kindle any fire in the Park.
7. Persons shall not (unless and until they have obtained permission from the Trustees) sell, or offer for sale any article of merchandise within the boundaries of the Park.
8. If any person offend against any of the above Regulations he will be dealt with under the 67th Clause of the
Amending Land Act 1865
, and all persons employed in the Park are hereby required to give information to the nearest Bailiff of Crown Lands if any person knowingly and wilfully offend against any of these Regulations.
duly signed by the Board of Land and Works, under its seal, I have the honor to point out that the provisions of the 67th Section of the Amending Land Act, 1865, require that such rules be published in the Government Gazette and exhibited in some conspicuous part of the reserve.
On 10 February 1866, M minuted: 'The Trustees of the Royal Park would feel greatly obliged if the Board of Land & Works would be pleased to give publicity to these regulations in the Gov-Gazette'. The regulations appeared in the Victoria government gazette , 13 February 1866, p. 381.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Your most obedient Servant,
The file copy is not signed.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: for the Asst Commissioner of Lands & Survey
